summary: The degree Celsius (째C) is how we measure temperature in most countries. It's named after the scientist Anders Celsius. The scale starts at 0째C for water's freezing point and goes up to 100째C for its boiling point. This system replaced the "centigrade" scale in 1948 to honor Celsius. It's part of the International System of Units (SI). Since 2007, it's been linked to the Kelvin scale, with absolute zero being -273.15째C.
title: Celsius
